verbose_text: In non infected control animals, a small number of myeloid cells showed expression of the anti-inflammatory marker CD206, a C-type lectin receptor, which was downregulated upon VSV infection, whereas expression of CD86, a marker of activated myeloid cells, was upregulated on myeloid cells upon infection (XREF_SUPPLEMENTARY C and S1D).
evidence: expression of the anti-inflammatory marker CD206
